intro: Chromolaena squalida, commonly known as the roughleaf chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant has rough, hairy foliage and produces small, yellowish flowers that attract various pollinators. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields due to its adaptability. Chromolaena squalida is also known for its rapid growth and can become invasive in certain areas.
